DOC.brief_summary: Intrauterine device can cause pain and discomfort in several ways: Use of the tenaculum to grasp the cervix and straighten the uterus for proper insertion; trans-cervical actions including measuring uterine depth, inserting the insertion tube, and removing the tube; and placement of the device in the uterus.
DOC.brief_title: Lidocaine In-situ Gel Before Intrauterine Device Insertion
DOC.criteria: Women not taken analgesics or anxiolytics in the 24 hours prior insertion Women not taken misoprostol prior to insertion No contraindication to or history of allergic reaction to lidocaine Women who will accept to participate in the study Lidocaine allergy Any contraindication to device placement
